data.title: Restaurant Week
data.text:
Only traveling through, my husband selected this place, but we did not know that they were honoring Restaurant Week.  The menu was a 3 course meal for $40.  The sides were $7.50.  My husband ordered two starters (5 baked oysters topped with corn meal mix and a salad with arugula, apple, etc) and an entree of fried catfish with gumbo!  He loved it, but I didn't care for the corn meal mix on the baked oyster nor the gumbo (rue was too bitter).  

I wanted a regular menu, but was told it was not available (later I heard that it was) so I ordered a side of spinach with onions & ginger.  It was okay as it was sautéed in their own made butter, but could not taste the ginger.  Corn bread with butter accompanied the meal.  Would have love too known what was available on the regular menu.

It was good that we arrived around 5:30 because by the time we left around 7:00 there was a full house!

data.title: Always fantastic!
data.text: Harper's Table is our favorite, often-visited Suffolk restaurant. From the great bar to the expertly-prepared seasonal meals, we always enjoy our time here!

data.title: One of the Best Meals I have Ever Had
data.text: My husband and I went to Harper's Table on the first night of restaurant week.  Did not know it was restaurant week but it was great for us because we were able to really experience how amazing the chef's skills are!  We first tried the pork belly biscuit and it was perfection. That was followed by a tasty cauliflower soup (who knew cauliflower could be so delicious!) and a deconstructed chicken pot pie.   We both had the pork tenderloin with chile mac and cheese and it was the best pork tenderloin I have ever had.  The flavor and texture were incredible.  For dessert, I had the corn pudding and my husband had the neopolitan ice cream sundae.  Both were the perfect ending to an incredible meal.  The only time I have had a meal this outstanding was in Manhattan.  The restaurant has a pleasant vibe and our waitress was friendly and was happy to explain our choices. The owner came by our table twice to make sure that we had everything we needed and that our meal was to our satisfaction.  My husband and I commented that even the music was the perfect choice for the background. I can't wait to come back again because I understand the menu changes frequently to reflect what is fresh, in keeping with their farm to table philosophy. The menu says fine dining but the price is more mid range. Well worth the drive.

data.title: Tricks no Treats
data.text: Had been here once before and thought the food very good so we decided to try again. Showed up with a 7pm reservation to celebrate my Anniversary and the place was closed. No lights, no staff, no note on the door. I called the restaurant and got their VM, which specifically said they were open this evening. Hmmm... might not want to accept reservations when your restaurant is closed and you may get want to update your voicemail as well. Can think of no reason to go to Suffolk to try this place again.

data.title: Best meal here, ever
data.text: We have visited here many times, but tonight was peak! Great meal. Great ambiance.  You folks need to try this place.  If you want PERFECTLY prepared food, this is the place.  We will be back... a lot more often!

data.title: Five Stars!!
data.text: The food is awesome and so is the wait staff!  Fresh, creative specials changing daily.  Limited kids menu but kiddos loved the pasta and cheese sauce.  I had appetizers as my meal.  Both were specials.  One greens with cheese & apples and butter bean ravioli with ham.  Fabulous!  Desserts were awesome!  Homemade ginger cookie ice cream sandwich with pumpkin ice cream, yum!  Worth a trip to downtown Suffolk :)

data.title: Exceeded Expectations
data.text:
Service = excellent
Starter Selection = varied, substantial and something for everyone: pork belly biscuit, deviled eggs, oysters, hush puppies savory and sweet
Supper = shrimp and grits, rib eye, pork belly (it's a lot of pork belly!)
Sides = great fries, spinach cooked perfectly with a bit of heat
Dessert = specials were on point: pumpkin ice cream sandwiched between two chewy gingersnaps, buttermilk ice cream with maple syrup
Drinks = nice wine selection by the glass (surprised to see an Albarino) and bottle; dessert wines, small, but curated beer selection and a whiskey selection.

data.title: Best Shrimp n' Grits I've Ever Found!
data.text: Had dinner at Harper's Table last night.. Super fresh, locally sourced ingredients mixed with a very talented chef led to a great dinner.  Quail starter was on point.  We moved to our main course of Shrimp n Grits and Duck Breast.  Fat on the duck was rendered crispy and the temperature was a perfect rare.  My better half said it was like "Duck Candy".  Desert was the most surprising yet delicious ice cream ever.. Sweet Corn Flavored Ice Cream sandwiched between 2 chocolate chip jalapeño cookies... SO GOOD!!!  Service was prompt and excellent.  The bar tender knew how to make a proper Old Fashioned as well.  I will be back!

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text: Have been here a number of times and never been disappointed. The food is quite good and the service is excellent. There is a good selection but not overwhelming. If it is on the menu, it will be good.

data.title: Our Go-To spot!
data.text: We have been here 3 times for dinner now and this place never disappoints! From the salad to the dessert, every dish is great! Last meal for me was the steak and it was cooked perfectly and was so juicy. My husband had the Lamb burger with hand cut fries and that was great as well. Gotta try the hushpuppies and a cocktail!

data.title: Great atmosphere, service, eats, drinks
data.text:
Wine was spot on.
Food was outstanding. Duck,burger,grits, and salads were farm fresh delicious.
Service was attentive,friendly, and professional
Upscale glitz of 1940's but the best part was the tables were not piled on top of the next. Great for conversations over great drinks and food.

data.title: Superb
data.text: Guess you could call the cuisine traditional Southern, but regardless it is superb. This was a revisit and once again food was extraordinary -- well prepared and presented.  Even the burger and fries are terrific ad were sausage biscuit, meat plate and Tommy clams.

data.title: Great food, great atmosphere
data.text: My wife and I really enjoy this restaurant for a night out.  The food is excellent and the staff attentive.   We like that the restaurant caters to more of an adult audience as this enhances the atmosphere for a night out as a couple or with friends.  We plan on going back for my wife's birthday.  We were introduced to a Moscato from Australia called Innocent Bystander which would be great on hot summer day.  Overall experience is outstanding.

data.title: Well Worth It
data.text: We called in a pickup order and were very pleased.  My husband had the Clam Pasta dish and Pork Belly Biscuit.  I had the Pork Belly Biscuit, a deviled egg, and cheddar grits.  All the food was delicious.  I should've had more of the lovely and tasty deviled eggs and less grits, which were a little too cheesy for me.  Also, for dessert we shared the cornbread pudding, which was an unexpected, spectacular surprise.

data.title: Gourmet dining in a casual atmosphere
data.text: We had a relaxing dinner for two after a long day, including mixed drinks, shrimp and grits, crab and pasta, sauteed spinach, and fancy desserts.  The food and service was impeccable.  This was our first visit to Suffolk; we were surprised to find such a great place for dinner. It was good we thought to make reservations in advance.  The restaurant was almost full.

data.title: Braswell wedding party
data.text: OMG! Best steak and potatoes ever. Very classy and the food is a 5 star.  Wish I lived here just to eat at this place once a week!!!

data.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE
data.text: Used TA to pick Harper's Table and was not disappointed. Very pleasant ambiance with a contemporary feel.  We started with deviled eggs and soft shell crab.  They were very accommodating as the soft shell were only on the menu as an entre.  They were willing to do a single soft shell crab as an appetizer at a very fair price.  We shared the rib eye which was to rare and returned for more time on the grill. The rib eye was on the pricey side but since we shared it was acceptable. Recommend and would return. Hope this helps.

data.title: Southern Gourmet Restaurant Tucked in on Main Street
data.text:
Vast wine list. Unusual cocktails and appetizers. The chef creatives dishes that are locally sourced.
Our party enjoyed the hushpuppies and olives for the app. There were a variety of main dishes which all parties' said were excellent. Our servers were very attentive keeping our glasses full. Their house-made ice cream is excellent with my favorite being the raspberry sorbet.

data.title: Great Dishes with Southern Flair!
data.text: We are always pleasantly pleased with the dishes we have at Harper's Table. This time we went to a wine tasting at the restaurant where they featured Michael Shaps' wines. What a treat! We also had a dish that was prepared from the James Beard House recently. Beets, pistachio, first softshell crabs, ravioli, duck and strawberry tart all were especially prepared in their own right with a specific wine pairing. A very special evening! All of Harper's dishes are incredible! The staff is also very friendly. Fun evening!

data.title: Some interesting stuff, but some sort of bland stuff, too.
data.text:
The Pork Belly Biscuit was really, and small enough to be a great appetizer for one. Cornbread was room temperature and came out with our meal rather than before. Not sure if this is normal, but the bread was still good. I feel like it would have been better warm. The cocktail list was a mix of a few staples and some interesting concoctions. My wife had a sidecar, and I had dead reviver or something like that. Both cocktails were alright - not particularly strong, but not terribly flavorful either. For entrées, my wife had shrimp & grits with andouille sausage. The sausage was quite strong, but it didn't ruin the dish. It did give the shrimp a smokey flavor. My pork schnitzel was kind of bland, as was the cabbage on which it rested. I appreciate that it's a unique take on a German staple, but the only German-ish flavor to be found was the tasty potato bits mingled in with the cabbage. The place itself is nice, the staff was friendly and helpful. We sat in the back room which has a bunch of AC registers. It's almost impossible not to sit under one, so plan ahead if you get cold easily! Fortunately, we were the first people in the room, and I think they turned the AC off for my wife.

I would give this more than 3, but less than 4 (3.75?). Better than average, but less than I expected. 2 drinks, 2 biscuits and 2 entrees came to $90.
